OSINT(Open-Source Intelligence) BOB(Bank Of Bhutan)

1. Introduction

Objective:

This report provides an Open-Sourve Intellignece (OSINT) analysis of Bank Of Bhutan(BOB), identifying its digital footprint, potential vulnerabilities, and risks associated with public information exposure.

The scope includes examining website security, social media presence, data breaches, employee exposure, and third-party risks.

Tools used:Google Dorking, WHOIS lookup, and social media analysis.

Target:

Bank Name: Bank of Bhutan(BOB)

Background:

The Bank of Bhutan(BoB) is the largest and oldest commercial bank in Bhutan, established under a royal bharter in May 1968. Initially, BoB served as the country’s only centrak bank until the establishment of the Royal Monetary Authority of Bhutan (RMA) in 1982. It is now registered under the Companies Act of Bhutan, 2000, operating as a public sector commercial bank.

Over the years, BoB has expanded its presence across the country, maintaining over 47 branches in all Dzongkhags (districts). It was a pioneer in introducing ATMs, Point of Sales (PoS) terminals, and Internet Banking services in Bhutan, significantly modernizing the banking sector.

As of July 1, 2017, the bank's total assets were valued at 47.7 million Ngultrum (approximately USD 750,000), with a major portion allocated to consumer loans and mortgages. BoB holds a dominant position in Bhutan's banking industry, accounting for 41% of total deposits and 32% of total loans in the national economy.

Reason for Selection:

BoB being a high-profile bank, it presents a valuable case study in understanding how public information can expose cybersecurity risks.

2. Information Gathering

2.1 Digital Footprint

Website: www.bob.bt

Subdomains identified:

To find these subdomains I used (site:*bob.bt), there are many subdomains but I chose couple of subdomain which I assume that the information are sensitive and could be used by red-hackers.

  • account.bob.bt (BoBaccount - Online Account Opening)
  • bob.bt/vendor-registration (Vendor registration)
  • bob.bt/auction-announcement (Auction Notice- Dec 6th, 2024)
  • bob.bt/5147-2 (Final Selected Candidates- Post of Customer Experience Representative and EPABX)
  • bob.bt/disclaimer/disclaimer (Disclaimer)
  • bob.bt/tender-amendment (Tender Amendment)
  • bob.bt/PIT_Certificates (Loan Interest Certificate for PIT)
  • internetbanking.bob.bt/bobcorporate/# (Corporate Internet Banking)

Using Shoden:

I couldn’t find anything from using the shoden tool. The reasons could be:

  • BoB uses Cloudflare or a Firewall
  • IP-Based Blocking
  • Uses private IPs - If the systems are internal, they won’t show up on Shoden.

WHOIS Data:

Could not find any information from here.

2.2 Social Media Presence

Linkedin:

  • Ceo of BoB is Mr. Dorji Kadin

  • Picture of 14 new employee who recently joined BoB.

  • Vacancy announcement of four months earlier.

  • Digital Payments Security training at BoB was led by Mufaddal Taskin from the INSTITUTE OF INFORMATION SECURITY.

Risk: The attackers can get information about the CEO of the company and could be further exploited, and attackers could do phishing attack.

2.3 Employee Information:

From the linkedin I was able to find the profile images of the employers of BoB company. I would say all employers profile is given, which I took few of them.

The person in the middle in second photo has the name instead of his position.
From this, I was able to get his information.

That person is database administrator of BoB.

With using the method, {bob.bt site:linkedin.com} as I already know that there are information leaked about the employees. So, I was able to find many information, name and the role of the employees working in BoB.

There were many information about the employees

Risk: Employees interacting on LinkedIn openly disclose their job roles which could be exploited by attackers.

2.4 Leaked Information

Using the method, {site:github.com bob.bt} I was able to find the github for go-bob.

From here, I went through the profile of the person and I was able to find couple of repositories from 33 of it which had go as initial-name which I assume that it could be related to go-bob.

Risk: Attacker could go through the code of the app and could figure out how the app works. Which would make easier for the hackers.

2.5 Infrastructure Analysis

  • Security Headers Missing:

  1. Strict-Transport-Security
  1. Content-Security-Policy
  1. X-Frame-Options
  1. X-Content-Type-Options
  1. Referrer-Policy
  1. Permissions-Policy

Risk: Without these security headers, the bank is vulnerable to MITM attacks, XSS injections, clickjacking, MIME-type sniffing, data leaks, and unauthorized access to user devices. This can lead to credential theft, financial fraud, malware execution, privacy breaches, and reputational damage.

Conclusion

The OSINT investigation of BankOfBhutan revealed several security risks, including exposed employee credentials, and outdated infrastructure. While the bank has strong cloud-based security, there are still areas that need to be improved, particularly in social media security awareness and infrastructure.
